column2: The Norse sack [From.GetName]!
The Norse scourge has poured through the Gates of [From.GetName] and sacked the holy city! It has been left a smoldering ruin and the streets now run red with the blood of its former inhabitants.
Like raging wolves...
The Norse sack [From.GetName]!
The Norse scourge has poured through the Gates of [From.GetName] and sacked the holy city! It has been left a smoldering ruin and the streets now run red with the blood of its former inhabitants.
Perhaps their bloodlust has been sated now.
column3: Espérons que leur soif de sang est assouvie, pour le moment.
column4: Vielleicht ist ihre Gier nach Blut jetzt gestillt.
column6: Puede que su sed de sangre haya quedado satisfecha.

column2: The Norse sack [From.GetName]!
The Norse scourge has poured through the Gates of [From.GetName] and sacked the holy city! It has been left a smoldering ruin and the streets now run red with the blood of its former inhabitants.
They must be stopped!
The Norse sack [From.GetName]!
The Norse scourge has poured through the Gates of [From.GetName] and sacked the holy city! It has been left a smoldering ruin and the streets now run red with the blood of its former inhabitants.
Barbarians!
The Norse sack [From.GetName]!
The Norse scourge has poured through the Gates of [From.GetName] and sacked the holy city! It has been left a smoldering ruin and the streets now run red with the blood of its former inhabitants.
There seems to be no reprieve from these accursed Norse.
column3: Ces maudits nordiques n'accordent aucun répit à leurs victimes.
column4: Es scheint, wir werden keine Ruhe vor diesen verfluchten Normannen haben.
column6: Parece que no hay respiro posible con estos malditos nórdicos

column2: The Norse sack [From.GetName]!
The Norse scourge has poured through the Gates of [From.GetName] and sacked the holy city! It has been left a smoldering ruin and the streets now run red with the blood of its former inhabitants.
May they suffer a thousand deaths for their crimes!
column3: Que ces monstres souffrent au centuple de ce qu'ils ont pu infliger !
column4: Mögen sie für ihr Verbrechen unzählige Male sterben!
column6: ¡Que sufran mil muertes por sus crímenes!

column2: The Norse sack [From.GetName]!
The Norse scourge has poured through the Gates of [From.GetName] and sacked the holy city! It has been left a smoldering ruin and the streets now run red with the blood of its former inhabitants.
Is this the end of days?
column6: ¿Es este el fin de los días?

column2: The Norse sack [From.GetName]!
The Norse scourge has poured through the Gates of [From.GetName] and sacked the holy city! It has been left a smoldering ruin and the streets now run red with the blood of its former inhabitants.
Surely that can't be true!
The Norse sack [From.GetName]!
The Norse scourge has poured through the Gates of [From.GetName] and sacked the holy city! It has been left a smoldering ruin and the streets now run red with the blood of its former inhabitants.
May they suffer an eternity of pain!
column3: Qu'ils souffrent dans une éternité de douleur !

column2: The Norse sack [From.GetName]!
The Norse scourge has poured through the Gates of [From.GetName] and sacked the holy city! It has been left a smoldering ruin and the streets now run red with the blood of its former inhabitants.
Is there no place beyond their reach?
column3: Aucune ville n'est donc à l'abri de la menace mongole ?
column4: Gibt es überhaupt noch Länder, die sie nicht erreichen können?
column6: ¿No queda lugar fuera de su alcance?

column2: The Norse sack [From.GetName]!
The Norse scourge has poured through the Gates of [From.GetName] and sacked the holy city! It has been left a smoldering ruin and the streets now run red with the blood of its former inhabitants.
Such butchery will not go unpunished.
column3: Un tel massacre ne restera pas impuni !
column4: Solch ein Gemetzel bleibt nicht ungestraft.

column2: The Norse sack [From.GetName]!
The Norse scourge has poured through the Gates of [From.GetName] and sacked the holy city! It has been left a smoldering ruin and the streets now run red with the blood of its former inhabitants.
Have they no regard for culture?
column3: N'ont-ils donc aucun respect pour les civilisations ?
column4: Haben sie keine Respekt für Kultur?
column6: ¿Es que no sienten respeto por la cultura?

column2: The Norse sack [From.GetName]!
The Norse scourge has poured through the Gates of [From.GetName] and sacked the holy city! It has been left a smoldering ruin and the streets now run red with the blood of its former inhabitants.
There will come a time of reckoning.
column3: Viendra le temps des règlements de comptes.
column4: Die Zeit der Abrechnung wird kommen.

column2: The Norse sack [From.GetName]!
The Norse scourge has poured through the Gates of [From.GetName] and sacked the holy city! It has been left a smoldering ruin and the streets now run red with the blood of its former inhabitants.
May it be the last city the Norse take!
column3: Espérons que cette ville sera la dernière prise des nordiques !
column4: So möge es die letzte Stadt sein, die die Normannen nehmen!
column6: ¡Que sea la última ciudad que toman los nórdicos!

column2: The Norse sack [From.GetName]!
The Norse scourge has poured through the Gates of [From.GetName] and sacked the holy city! It has been left a smoldering ruin and the streets now run red with the blood of its former inhabitants.
This time they have gone too far!
column4: Diesmal sind sie zu weit gegangen!

column2: The Norse sack Mecca!

The Holy City of Mecca now burns at the cruel touch of the Norse infidels. Pilgrims journeying from distant lands to show their submission to Allah are met only with death when approaching the city gates. This unforgivable desecration will be remembered for ages to come.
column3: La ville sainte de La Mecque est à présent en feu, suite au passage des infidèles nordiques. Les pèlerins venus de pays lointains afin de montrer leur dévouement à Allah n'ont rencontré que la mort, tandis qu'ils approchaient des portes de la ville. Cette p
column4: Die Heilige Stadt Mekka steht nun in Flammen, da sie in die Hände der grausamen, nordischen Ungläubigen geraten ist. Wallfahrer, die aus fernen Ländern hierher gereist sind, um ihre Unterwerfung unter Allah zu zeigen, stoßen nur auf den Tod, sobald sie
column6: La Ciudad Sagrada de La Meca ahora arde bajo la cruel mano de los nórdicos infieles. Los peregrinos han llegado de tierras lejanas para mostrar su sumisión a Alá y, al aproximarse a las murallas, sólo han encontrado la muerte. Esta imperdonable profanación se recordará por muchos años venideros.

column2: Not a single infidel taking part in this affront will escape justice
column3: Tout infidèle ayant pris part à cet affront verra son destin remis entre les mains de la justice.
column4: Kein einziger Ungläubiger, der an diesem Affront teilnimmt, wird der Gerechtigkeit entkommen
column6: Ni un solo infiel que haya tomado parte en esta afrenta escapará a la justicia.

column2: The Fall of [From.GetName]

Brave Norse warriors have poured through the Gates of [From.GetName] and sacked the once proud holy city. It has been left a smoldering ruin and the streets now run red with the blood of its former inhabitants.
They shall never forget our might.
column4: Sie werden unsere Macht niemals vergessen.

The Fall of Mecca

The Muslim Holy City of Mecca now burns at the hands of Norse warriors. Pilgrims journeying from distant lands to show their submission to Allah are met only with death when approaching the city gates. This desecration will be remembered for ages to come, hopefully as an important lesson on the price of defying the powerful Norse nation.
column3: La ville sainte musulmane de La Mecque est à présent en feu, après le passage des guerriers nordiques. Les pèlerins venus de pays lointains afin de montrer leur dévouement à Allah n'ont rencontré que la mort, tandis qu'ils approchaient des portes de la ville. On se rappellera cette profanation pendant de nombreuses années. Souhaitons que ce sera une importante leçon à retenir : le prix à payer pour avoir défié la puissante nation nordique.
column4: Die muslimische Heilige Stadt Mekka steht in Flammen durch nordische Krieger. Pilger, die aus fernen Ländern kamen, um Allah zu huldigen, fanden nur den Tod, als sie sich den Toren der Stadt näherten. Diese Entweihung wird noch viele kommende Zeitalter in Erinnerung bleiben und hoffentlich eine wichtige Lektion des Preises sein, den man zahlt, wenn man der mächtigen nordischen Nation trotzt.
column6: La Ciudad Santa Musulmana de La Meca ahora arde en manos de los guerreros Nórdicos. Los peregrinos viajando desde tierras lejanas para mostrar su sumisión a Alá se encuentran con la muerte al acercarse a las puertas de la ciudad. Esta profanación será recordada durante mucho tiempo, con suerte como una lección importante sobre el precio por desafiar a la poderosa nación Nórdico.
